definition: to reform oneself/to mend one's ways and start life anew
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
to reform and start afresh (idiom); to turn over a new leaf
to repent and start afresh (idiom); to turn over a new leaf

sentences.english: He decided to turn over a new leaf and study harder.
sentences.chinese: 他决定要改过自新而且用功读书。

sentences.english: After his release from prison, John vowed to live down his crimes.
sentences.chinese: 约翰出狱后立誓要悔过自新，使人们原谅他的罪行。

sentences.english: It's time you amended your ways.
sentences.chinese: 是你改过自新的时候了。

sentences.english: Repentance before a fresh start" is an important scholarly proposition made by LI Er quin his early period."
sentences.chinese: “悔过自新”是李二曲早期提出的重要学术主张。

sentences.english: So he then turned over a new leaf and decided to drop the pranks and tried his best to study.
sentences.chinese: 所以后来他改过自新，决定停止做恶作剧并努力学习。

sentences.english: Xinhua described the gift as 'an act of remorse' from Li for associating China's ubiquitous animal with his criminal activity.
sentences.chinese: 新华社称该捐赠是李俊对自己将犯罪行为的悔过自新。

sentences.english: I just wanted to get my own heart right before God.
sentences.chinese: 我只希望能够在上帝面前改过自新。

sentences.english: A special group has been set up in the school to help her.
sentences.chinese: 学校为此成立了一个特别小组，以帮助她改过自新。

sentences.english: His wife will keep him straight when he is released from prison.
sentences.chinese: 他出狱后，他的妻子将帮助他悔过自新。

sentences.english: Love that does not renew itself every day becomes a habit and in turn a slavery.
sentences.chinese: 不日日自新的爱情，变成一种习惯，而终于变成奴役。

sentences.english: He has straightened up and make something of himself.
sentences.chinese: 他已改过自新，并决心成为一个有所作为的人。

sentences.english: Do not we become penitent and remorseful and crave for reunion?
sentences.chinese: 难道我们不能悔过自新，渴望重建联盟吗？

sentences.english: He opened his home to gang members who were trying to go straight and he went to college to get an education.
sentences.chinese: 他帮助愿意悔过自新的帮派成员，并上了大学。

sentences.english: He decided to turn over a new leaf. He would live simply and regain the respect of his family.
sentences.chinese: 他决定改过自新，艰苦朴素，重新得到家人的尊敬。

sentences.english: Have I rehabilitated myself, you ask?
sentences.chinese: 你问我有没有悔过自新？

definition: to attend/to take office/to be present (in administrative capacity)
change of dynasties/clear out the old, bring in the new
bring order out of chaos/set to rights things which have been thrown into disorder
old variant of 曆|历[li4]/old variant of 歷|历[li4]
